Job Title: R&D Materials Scientist / Engineer

Location: Golden Valley, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it!

At Honeywell Advanced Connected Sustainability Technologies (ACST), our outstanding team of thinkers, innovators, and doers help make the future. We build environments and technologies that meet our customers' needs. The groundbreaking scientists, engineers, and professionals that make up our nimble group have the agility of a start-up backed with the power and investment of Honeywell.

Join a team with expertise in physics, cryogenics, complex control systems, cyber security, and more to incubate novel technologies that shape the future! #futureshaper

Honeywell’s ACST team is seeking a R&D Materials Scientist/Engineer for our Golden Valley, MN location.

Citizenship Required: United States CitizenshipClearance Required: Yes; you must either currently have or be able to obtain and maintain an active U.S. Government security clearanceTelecommute: No - Teleworking not available for this positionTravel Required: Some travel required – 20%Relocation Assistance: Relocation assistance may be available.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

In addition to a competitive salary, leading-edge work, and developing solutions side-by-side with dedicated experts in their fields, Honeywell ACST employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package. This package includes employer subsidized Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance; Short-Term and Long-Term Disability; 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, EAP, and Educational Assistance; Parental Leave, Paid Time Off (for vacation and/or personal business), and 12 Paid Holidays. A relocation package is available to support your move to one of our locations. This role is also eligible for a discretionary incentive bonus in addition to base pay.

Your Role Will Include

Conduct research and development activities in the field of materials scienceDesign and conduct experiments investigating key material properties and performance in processes / applications such as welding, brazing, soldering, plating, joinery, interfaces, metal additive manufacturing.Analyze data and present findings to internal and external stakeholdersCollaborate with cross-functional teams to drive technology advancementsStay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies

Us Citizenship Requirements

Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.

You Must Have

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a technical discipline such as material science, engineering, physics, chemistry, are related fieldMinimum 2 years combined experience in one or more of the following: metallurgical science, welding or brazing applications, additive manufacturing, surface characterization or modificationStrong background in materials characterization techniques and analysisU.S. citizenship to obtain and maintain a security clearance

We Value

We value candidates who may have one or more of the following skills:

Advanced or specialized degree in Materials Science, Materials Science and Engineering, Metallurgical Engineering, Welding Engineering, or similarUnderstanding of experimental design and principles of failure analysisExperience with materials surface or interface analysisKnowledge of advanced materials characterization methodsExcellent communication skills (written and oral), organizational skills and analytical skills

This role will remain open until an offer is accepted.

#ACST

Additional Information

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
